pytket.backends.forest¶

Backends for connecting to devices and simulators from the Rigetti Forest platform directly from pytket

class pytket.backends.forest.ForestBackend(qc_name, simulator=True)¶
__init__(qc_name, simulator=True)¶

Backend for running simulations on the Rigetti QVM or a QCS device

Parameters:
  • qc_name – The name of the particular QuantumComputer to use. See the pyQuil docs for more details.
  • simulator (bool) – Whether to simulate the architecture or try to connect to a physical device
run(circuit: pytket._circuit.Circuit, shots: int, fit_to_constraints: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray¶

Run a circuit on the Rigetti QVM or a QCS device.

Return type:

ndarray
Parameters:
  • circuit (Circuit) – The circuit to run
  • shots (int) – Number of shots (repeats) to run
  • fit_to_constraints (bool) – Compile the circuit to meet the constraints of the backend, defaults to True
Returns:

Table of shot results, each row is a shot, columns are ordered by qubit ordering. Values are 0 or 1, corresponding to qubit basis states.
